###  Air Asia QZ 8501: Which state is in charge of certifying airworthiness? 

Sunday, December 28, 2014  [ Unknown ](https://www.blogger.com/profile/00655928445009738553 "author profile")

Currently, the Indonesian SAR team is still looking for _AirAsia_ QZ 8501 losing contact _somewher_ e in near the Belitung regions. QZ 8501, PK-AXC is registered in Indonesia. Here's the aircraft detail according to airfleets.net:

**Status : Written off**  
**Last Registration : PK-AXC**

**Last Airline****[**Indonesia Airasia**](http://www.airfleets.net/flottecie/Indonesia%20Airasia.htm)** Country : Indonesia  
Date : 2005 -   
Codes QZ AWQ   
Callsign : Wagon Air

Web site : [http://www.airasia.com](http://www.airasia.com/)

General information & flightlog  
Serial number3648Type320-216First flight date25/09/2008Test registrationF-WWBZSeat configuration[W10](http://www.airfleets.net/ficheapp/plane-a320-3648.htm#) [Y180](http://www.airfleets.net/ficheapp/plane-a320-3648.htm#)   
**Flights recorded**  
QZ8501SUB->SIN28/12/14QZ8501SUB->SIN28/12/14QZ663SIN->SRG10/11/14[See details](http://www.airfleets.net/flightlog/index.php?file=result&app=a320&msn=3648) \- [Add a flight](http://www.airfleets.net/flightlog/add.htm) Engines2 x CFMI CFM56-5B6/3 

Here is the plane's picture from[ planepictures](http://www.planepictures.net/netshow.php?id=1285901), taken in Changi in February, 2014. More pictures availabe [here](http://www.planepictures.net/netsearch4.cgi?stype=reg&srng=1&srch=PK-AXC).

![](data:image/jpeg;base64,)

According to [ICAO regulations](http://cfapp.icao.int/fsix/_Library%5CDoc9734_Part_A.pdf), Indonesia as the state of registry is responsible in monitoring and issuing the certificate of airworthiness and in ensuring airworthiness regardless of where it is operated.
